definition: to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together

sentences.english: We can't take you seriously when you just bandy words.
sentences.chinese: 當你們僅僅是互相鬥嘴時我們不能當真。

sentences.english: They bickered and got on each other's cases, sure.
sentences.chinese: 他們鬥嘴而且上彼此情形，當然。

sentences.english: Vindictive little men and women squabble, with a different kind of relationship.
sentences.chinese: 小男女鬥嘴鬥氣，有了一種別樣的關係。

sentences.english: Whenever the phone rings they bicker over who must answer it.
sentences.chinese: 每當電話鈴響起，他們就鬥嘴，誰必須回答。

sentences.english: They split up, spread out, sunned themselves, bickered.
sentences.chinese: 他們鬧翻，舒展身軀曬太陽，他們鬥嘴。

sentences.english: These squabbling Tolstoys and their stilted histrionics were conceited and exasperating.
sentences.chinese: 這些鬥嘴的托爾斯泰們和他們誇張的表演真令人惱火。

sentences.english: At this scene, he was bickering with his aunt.
sentences.chinese: 在他與姨媽鬥嘴的那一幕裏。

sentences.english: The two children were always bickering with each other over small matters.
sentences.chinese: 這兩個孩子總是爲些小事鬥嘴。

sentences.english: The New-year bells are wrangling with the snow.
sentences.chinese: 新年的鐘聲在跟雪花鬥嘴。

definition: to part on bad terms/(of a meeting etc) to break up in discord
lit. don't fight, won't make friends (idiom); an exchange of blows may lead to friendship/no discord, no concord
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
to fight and scheme against each other (idiom)/(in palace construction) elaborate and refined
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to treat each other as an honored guest (idiom)/mutual respect between husband and wife
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
to act in a fit of pique/to get in a huff/to be peeved
